Package ca.mcgill.ecse211.project

Class PathFinder

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.PathFinder
  • public class PathFinder
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements the atomic path-finding functions that allow the robot to compute the optimal path to a desired grid coordinate. It also contains a representation of the real-world competition grip through its map attribute. These atomic helper functions will be used to create the different compound navigation methods (i.e. the search zone traversal algorithm and the algorithm to carry the stranded back to the starting corner).
    Author:
    charlesbourbeau

      • configureTunnel

        private void configureTunnel​(boolean green,
                             int[] tnGLL,
                             int[] tnGUR,
                             int[] tnRLL,
                             int[] tnRUR)
        Configure the tunnel entry parameter such as position and angle to enter and exit the tunnel.
        Parameters:
        green - coordinate in tile unit
        tnGLL - lower left green tunnel coordinate in tile unit
        tnGUR - upper right green tunnel coordinate in tile unit
        tnRLL - lower left red tunnel coordinate in tile unit
        tnRUR - upper right red tunnel coordinate in tile unit

      • initStart

        private void initStart​(boolean green)
        Initialize the start location and angle based on the team color.
        Parameters:
        green - a boolean specifying whether the robot is green or red (false)

      • initMap

        private void initMap​(int[] tnLL,
                     int[] tnUR,
                     int[] izLL,
                     int[] izUR,
                     int[] ilLL,
                     int[] ilUR,
                     int[] szLL,
                     int[] szUR)
        Initialize the map of the course later used for traversal and path finding.
        Parameters:
        tnLL - tunnel coordinate lower left
        tnUR - tunnel coordinate upper right
        izLL - initial zone coordinate lower left
        izUR - initial zone coordinate upper right
        ilLL - island zone coordinate lower left
        ilUR - island zone coordinate upper right
        szLL - search zone coordinate lower left
        szUR - search zone coordinate upper right

      • aStar

        private java.util.ArrayList<int[]> aStar​(int x,
                                         int y,
                                         int tX,
                                         int tY,
                                         boolean search)
        The a* algorithm to find the shortest path to the target.
        Parameters:
        x - coordinate of the vehicle (in tile unit)
        y - coordinate of the vehicle (in tile unit)
        tX - target x coordinate (in tile unit)
        tY - target t coordinate (in tile unit)
        search - a tag that determine whether the algorithm will be searching or path finding.
        Returns:
        the shortest path to the target coordinate.
